etymology.description: Depicts a pair of elephant tusks -> used to indicate human molars
etymology.interpretation: The character 牙(牙) (yá, 'tooth') originated as a pictogram representing elephant tusks, which resemble human molars in shape. This specific imagery was chosen to signify back teeth rather than incisors.

examples.chinese: 我每天刷牙(我每天刷牙)。
examples.english: I brush my teeth every day.

examples.chinese: 医生检查牙齿(醫生檢查牙齒)，建议定期看牙(建議定期看牙)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng jiǎnchá yá chǐ, jiànyì dìngqī kàn yá.
examples.english: The doctor examines the teeth and advises regular dental check-ups.
